pr_title: Unit help - add a 'hasImage' to avoid unnecessary image rendering

timeline.message: Move method: 'getAllUnitsWithImages' from UnitType to UnitStatsTable
Simplify, inline always true method parameter
Remove game-locks, redundant and reading data that does not change once GameData is loaded
Use a Set and remove unnecessary contains checks
Fix inline of always true condition (if statement is always true!)
Simplify 'getImage' API, add overload that avoids 'false, false' parameters
Use ImageKey for key value of image cache
Continue replacing method parameters with ImageKey

FIX: Add and use 'hasImage' method when we only want to check for an image but not render it

This is a fix as the unnecessary rendering of images consumes enough resources
we can get an OOM when loading the Unit Help Menu.
Pmd fix: remove unused constructor parameter 'player'

timeline.bodyText: Method getPlayerUnitsWithImages has a Cognitive Complexity of 26 (exceeds 7 allowed). Consider refactoring.
timeline.author: codeclimate

timeline.bodyText: Method getPlayerUnitsWithImages has 36 lines of code (exceeds 30 allowed). Consider refactoring.
timeline.author: codeclimate

timeline.bodyText: Codacy found an issue: The method 'getBaseImageName()' has an NPath complexity of 102606, current threshold is 200
timeline.author: DanVanAtta

timeline.bodyText:
Could you explain why this if statement is always true?
If all is no subset of unitsSoFar this isn't always the case
